member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue.AddApplicationMessage
member.summary: Adds a user-defined message to the message queue and sends that message to the debug output.
member.param: A -typed value that specifies the severity of the message.
The message string.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue.AddMessage
member.summary: Adds a debug message to the message queue and sends that message to the debug output.
member.param: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that produced the message.
A -typed value that specifies the category of the message.
A -typed value that specifies the severity of the message.
An integer that uniquely identifies the message.
The message string.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue.AddRetrievalFilterEntries
member.summary: Adds retrieval filters to the top of the retrieval-filter stack.
member.param: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that produced the filters.
An array of structures that describe the filters.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue.AddStorageFilterEntries
member.summary: Adds storage filters to the top of the storage-filter stack.
member.param: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that produced the filters.
An array of structures that describe the filters.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue.ClearRetrievalFilter
member.summary: Removes a retrieval filter from the top of the retrieval-filter stack.
member.param: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that removes the filter.

member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue.ClearStorageFilter
member.summary: Removes a storage filter from the top of the storage-filter stack.
member.param: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that removes the filter.

member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue.ClearStoredMessages
member.summary: Clears all messages from the message queue.
member.param: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that clears the messages.

member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue.GetBreakOnCategory
member.summary: Determines whether the break on a message category is turned on or off.
member.param: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that gets the breaking status.
A -typed value that specifies the category of the message.
member.returns: Returns a Boolean value that specifies whether this category of breaking condition is turned on or off (TRUE for on, FALSE for off).

member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue.GetBreakOnID
member.summary: Determines whether the break on a message identifier is turned on or off.
member.param: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that gets the breaking status.
An integer value that specifies the identifier of the message.
member.returns: Returns a Boolean value that specifies whether this break on a message identifier is turned on or off (TRUE for on, FALSE for off).

member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue.GetBreakOnSeverity
member.summary: Determines whether the break on a message severity level is turned on or off.
member.param: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that gets the breaking status.
A -typed value that specifies the severity of the message.
member.returns: Returns a Boolean value that specifies whether this severity of breaking condition is turned on or off (TRUE for on, FALSE for off).

member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue.GetMessage
member.summary: Gets a message from the message queue.
member.param: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that gets the message.

An index into the message queue after an optional retrieval filter has been applied. This can be between 0 and the number of messages in the message queue that pass through the retrieval filter. Call to obtain this number. 0 is the message at the beginning of the message queue.
A pointer to a structure that describes the message.
A pointer to a variable that receives the size, in bytes, of the message description that pMessage points to. This size includes the size of the structure in bytes.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue.GetMessageCountLimit
member.summary: Gets the maximum number of messages that can be added to the message queue.
member.param: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that gets the number.
member.returns: Returns the maximum number of messages that can be added to the queue. –1 means no limit.

member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue.GetMuteDebugOutput
member.summary: Determines whether the debug output is turned on or off.
member.param: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that gets the mute status.
member.returns: Returns a Boolean value that specifies whether the debug output is turned on or off (TRUE for on, FALSE for off).

member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue.GetNumMessagesAllowedByStorageFilter
member.summary: Gets the number of messages that a storage filter allowed to pass through.
member.param: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that gets the number.
member.returns: Returns the number of messages allowed by a storage filter.

member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue.GetNumMessagesDeniedByStorageFilter
member.summary: Gets the number of messages that were denied passage through a storage filter.
member.param: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that gets the number.
member.returns: Returns the number of messages denied by a storage filter.

member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue.GetNumMessagesDiscardedByMessageCountLimit
member.summary: Gets the number of messages that were discarded due to the message count limit.
member.param: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that gets the number.
member.returns: Returns the number of messages that were discarded.

member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue.GetNumStoredMessages
member.summary: Gets the number of messages currently stored in the message queue.
member.param: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that gets the number.
member.returns: Returns the number of messages currently stored in the message queue.

member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue.GetNumStoredMessagesAllowedByRetrievalFilters
member.summary: Gets the number of messages that can pass through a retrieval filter.
member.param: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that gets the number.
member.returns: Returns the number of messages that can pass through a retrieval filter.

member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue.GetRetrievalFilter
member.summary: Gets the retrieval filter at the top of the retrieval-filter stack.
member.param: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that gets the filter.
A pointer to a structure that describes the filter.
A pointer to a variable that receives the size, in bytes, of the filter description to which pFilter points. If pFilter is NULL, GetRetrievalFilter outputs the size of the retrieval filter.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue.GetRetrievalFilterStackSize
member.summary: Gets the size of the retrieval-filter stack in bytes.
member.param: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that gets the size.
member.returns: Returns the size of the retrieval-filter stack in bytes.

member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue.GetStorageFilter
member.summary: Gets the storage filter at the top of the storage-filter stack.
member.param: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that gets the filter.
A pointer to a structure that describes the filter.
A pointer to a variable that receives the size, in bytes, of the filter description to which pFilter points. If pFilter is NULL, GetStorageFilter outputs the size of the storage filter.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue.GetStorageFilterStackSize
member.summary: Gets the size of the storage-filter stack in bytes.
member.param: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that gets the size.
member.returns: Returns the size of the storage-filter stack in bytes.

member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue.PopRetrievalFilter
member.summary: Pops a retrieval filter from the top of the retrieval-filter stack.
member.param: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that pops the filter.

member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue.PopStorageFilter
member.summary: Pops a storage filter from the top of the storage-filter stack.
member.param: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that pops the filter.

member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue.PushCopyOfRetrievalFilter
member.summary: Pushes a copy of the retrieval filter that is currently on the top of the retrieval-filter stack onto the retrieval-filter stack.
member.param: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that pushes the copy of the retrieval filter.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue.PushCopyOfStorageFilter
member.summary: Pushes a copy of the storage filter that is currently on the top of the storage-filter stack onto the storage-filter stack.
member.param: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that pushes the copy of the storage filter.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue.PushDenyAllRetrievalFilter
member.summary: Pushes a deny-all retrieval filter onto the retrieval-filter stack.
member.param: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that pushes the deny-all retrieval filter.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue.PushDenyAllStorageFilter
member.summary: Pushes a deny-all storage filter onto the storage-filter stack.
member.param: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that pushes the filter.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue.PushEmptyRetrievalFilter
member.summary: Pushes an empty retrieval filter onto the retrieval-filter stack.
member.param: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that pushes the empty retrieval filter.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue.PushEmptyStorageFilter
member.summary: Pushes an empty storage filter onto the storage-filter stack.
member.param: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that pushes the empty storage filter.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue.PushRetrievalFilter
member.summary: Pushes a retrieval filter onto the retrieval-filter stack.
member.param: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that pushes the filter.
A pointer to a structure that describes the filter.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue.PushStorageFilter
member.summary: Pushes a storage filter onto the storage-filter stack.
member.param: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that pushes the filter.
A pointer to a structure that describes the filter.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue.SetBreakOnCategory
member.summary: Sets a message category to break on when a message with that category passes through the storage filter.
member.param: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that sets the breaking condition.
A -typed value that specifies the category of the message.
A Boolean value that specifies whether SetBreakOnCategory turns on or off this breaking condition (TRUE for on, FALSE for off).
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue.SetBreakOnID
member.summary: Sets a message identifier to break on when a message with that identifier passes through the storage filter.
member.param: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that sets the breaking condition.
An integer value that specifies the identifier of the message.
A Boolean value that specifies whether SetBreakOnID turns on or off this breaking condition (TRUE for on, FALSE for off).
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue.SetBreakOnSeverity
member.summary: Sets a message severity level to break on when a message with that severity level passes through the storage filter.
member.param: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that sets the breaking condition.
A -typed value that specifies the severity of the message.
A Boolean value that specifies whether SetBreakOnSeverity turns on or off this breaking condition (TRUE for on, FALSE for off).
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue.SetMessageCountLimit
member.summary: Sets the maximum number of messages that can be added to the message queue.
member.param: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that sets the limit on the number of messages.
The maximum number of messages that can be added to the queue. –1 means no limit.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue.SetMuteDebugOutput
member.summary: Turns the debug output on or off.
member.param: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that gets the mute status.
A Boolean value that specifies whether to turn the debug output on or off (TRUE for on, FALSE for off).

member.name: IDXGIInfoQueue
member.summary: This interface controls the debug information queue, and can only be used if the debug layer is turned on.
